intro: Serpicula indica, commonly known as the Indian serpentine, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, slightly serrated edge, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Serpicula indica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
